# Git

> **Mac**: brew install git

> **Linux(Debian)** : apt-get install git-core

> **Linux(Fedora)** : yum install git-core

> **Windows** :  [Git](http://git-scm.com)


```
$ git config --global user.name "your name"
```
```
$ git config --global user.email "youremail@email.com"
```
 `--global` 


```
$ git config --list

user.email=joveyzheng@qq.com

user.name=joveyzheng

color.status=auto

...
```
 `$ git config <key> ` 
```
$ git config user.name

joveyzheng
```
# 
```
$ git help
```

#  RSS
 RSS



1. 
 **Hexo **
```
$ npm install --save hexo-generator-feed
```

2. 
 `_config.yml`  root  `_config.yml` 
```
# Extensions
## Plugins: http://hexo.io/plugins/
plugins:
  hexo-generate-feed
```
 `_config.yml` 
```
# Set rss to false to disable feed link.
# Leave rss as empty to use site's feed link.
# Set rss to specific value if you have burned your feed already.
rss: /atom.xml
```

<!-- more -->

3.  RSS Feed
 CLI 
```
$ hexo g
```
 `./public`  `atom.xml`  `Github`

```

  Twitter: https://twitter.com/XXX

# `cubic-bezier` CSS3 `animation-timing-function` `transition-timing-function` # ## `cubic-bezier` **** `animation` `cubic-bezier(, , , )` `cubic-bezier` ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-01.png) ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-02.jpg) `cubic-bezier` : * P0 (0, 0) * **P1 (x1, y1)** * **P2 (x2, y2)** * P3 (1, 1) P1 P2 **`X `** **0** **1** `cubic-bezier` `Y ` ** 1 X [0, 1]Y ** ## ```html Document
``` `transition` `cubic-bezier` `timing-function` `ease` ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-03.png) `cubic-bezier(.17, .86, .73, .14)` ```css ... .animation { ... -webkit-transition: all 2s cubic-bezier(.17, .86, .73, .14); -o-transition: all 2s cubic-bezier(.17, .86, .73, .14); transition: all 2s cubic-bezier(.17, .86, .73, .14); } ... ``` ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-04.png) ## `cubic-bezier` 1. `ease`cubic-bezier(.25, .1, .25, 1) ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-03.png) 2. `liner`cubic-bezier(0, 0, 1, 1) / cubic-bezier(1, 1, 0, 0) ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-05.png) 3. `ease-in`cubic-bezier(.42, 0, 1, 1) ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-06.png) 4. `ease-out`cubic-bezier(0, 0, .58, 1) ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-07.png) 5. `ease-in-out`cubic-bezier(.42, 0, .58, 1) ![cubic-bezier](/blog/images/article_img/cubic-bezier-08.png) 6. Hexo [ Nodejs ](https://nodejs.org/en/)[ Git ](http://git-scm.com/)
```
$ npm install -g hexo-cli
```

### 2. 
```
$ hexo init <yourFolder>
$ cd <yourFolder>
$ npm install
```
 
```
.
 _config.yml //  
 package.json
 scaffolds 	// Hexo  scaffold 
 source 	//
|    _drafts
|    _posts
 themes 	// Hexo 
```

### 3.  Hello World
```
$ hexo new "Hello World"
```
  `/source/_post`  `hello-world.md` 

### 4. 
```
$ hexo generate
```
  `/source`  `.md`  `/public` 

### 5. 
```
$ hexo server -p 3000
```
  `http://localhost:3000` 

### 6. 
```
$ hexo deploy
```
  `$ hexo generate -d`  `_config.yml` 
 ```
 ## Docs: http://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html
	deploy:
	  type: git
	  repo: git@github.com:YourRepository.git
	  branch: master
  ```

3. 
 ```
 $ git remote add author git@github.com:author/repos.git
 ```
  `$ git remote -v` 
 ```
 author git@github.com:author/repos.git (fetch)
 author git@github.com:author/repos.git (push)
 origin  git@github.com:yourname/repos.git (fetch)
 origin  git@github.com:yourname/repos.git (push)
 ```

```
$ git fetch author   //`author`
```

5. 
```
$ git merge author/master
```

6.  **Fork** 
```
$ git push origin master
```

commit/merge  commit/merge Git  `reset` command

# reset
## 1. 
```
$ git reset [--hard|soft|mixed|merge|keep] [<commit>|<HEAD>]
```
`[--hard|soft|mixed]``--hard`

## 2. 
 `$ git reset --hard HEAD^` `HEAD^`

 `$ git reset --hard fc232ae`  `fc232ae` commit 

## 3. 
 commit  command 

**`$ git pull` **
```
$ git push origin [branch] -f
```
Git 

<!-- more -->

 commit 56 commit  list  commit  commit  commit  commit  squash  commit  `rebase`
# rebase
## 1. 
```
$ git rebase -i [branch|<commit>]
```

 rebase  commit  rebase commit  `$ git rebase -i <commit>`

 rebase  `--continue``--absort`  `--skip`
## 2. 
```
$ git log
```
 commit  SHA  rebase 
## 3. rebase

```
$ git rebase -i 9cbc329
```

```
pick fb554f5 This is commit 1
pick 2bd1903 This is commit 2
pick d987ebf This is commit 3
# Rebase 9cbc329..d987ebf onto 9cbc329
#
# Commands:
# p, pick = use commit
# r, reword = use commit, but edit the commit message
# e, edit = use commit, but stop for amending
# s, squash = use commit, but meld into previous commit
# f, fixup = like "squash", but discard this commit's log message
# x, exec = run command (the rest of the line) using shell
#
# If you remove a line here THAT COMMIT WILL BE LOST.
# However, if you remove everything, the rebase will be aborted.
#
```
 `pick fb554f5 This is commit 1`
- `pick`: rebase command
- `fb554f5`commit shortIDID
- `This is commit 1` commit message

 `pick``squash``edit`  `pick`  `squash`

 `2bd1903`  `d987ebf `  `fb554f5 ` ** VIM  Linux [](#)**
```
pick fb554f5 This is commit 1
squash 2bd1903 This is commit 2
squash d987ebf This is commit 3
# Rebase 9cbc329..d987ebf onto 9cbc329
#

# p, pick = use commit
# r, reword = use commit, but edit the commit message
# e, edit = use commit, but stop for amending
# s, squash = use commit, but meld into previous commit
# f, fixup = like "squash", but discard this commit's log message
# x, exec = run command (the rest of the line) using shell
#
# If you remove a line here THAT COMMIT WILL BE LOST.
# However, if you remove everything, the rebase will be aborted.
#
```

$ git rebase -i 9cbc329

You are currently rebasing branch 'master' on '9cbc329'.

nothing to commit, working directory clean

Otherwise, please use 'git reset'

```
